alert.note: Alert for Alameda; Contra Costa; Marin; Napa; San Francisco; San Mateo; Sonoma (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 23 at 8:12AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, Alameda, Contra Costa, Marin, Napa, San Francisco, San Mateo and Sonoma. * WHEN...Until 1015 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 810 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain over the greater San Francisco Bay Area. This will cause urban and small stream flooding, especially in low-lying and poor drainage areas where culverts may be blocked. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Francisco, Oakland, Berkeley, Richmond, Daly City, Napa, Alameda, San Rafael, Novato, Martinez, San Pablo, Lafayette, El Cerrito, Hercules, American Canyon, Albany, Pinole, Orinda, Mill Valley and San Anselmo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Alameda; Contra Costa; Marin; Napa; San Francisco; San Mateo; Sonoma
